Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan must win against Canada to keep their chances alive in the tournament.
Canada are looking to cause another major upset in the tournament.
The unpredictable nature of the pitch in New York may work in Canada's favour.
Pakistan's assistant coach Azhar Mahmood said Pakistan's batters were guilty of poor shot selection and decision-making during the chase, which led to their loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan have lost to USA and India, and must win against Canada to have any chance of making it to the next stage of the T20 World Cup.
A loss will make their final Group A game against Ireland a mere formality before they make their way back home.
The pitch in New York continues to invite discussions and criticism from fans and experts, but it has steadily improved since hosting its first match on June 2.
Cloudy and humid weather is forecast in Long Island on Tuesday, which should allow a full game without any disruptions.
Others: Former captain Wasim Akram called for a culling of some of the underperforming players and changes to the team.

Pakistan's squad: Babar Azam (captain), Mohammad Rizwan, Saim Ayub, Fakhar Zaman, Usman Khan, Azam Khan, Iftikhar Ahmed, Imad Wasim, Shadab Khan, Mohammad Amir, Shaheen Shah Afridi, Naseem Shah, Abbas Afridi, Haris Rauf, Abrar Ahmed.

Canada's squad: Navneet Dhaliwal, Aaron Johnson, Ravinderpal Singh, Kanwarpal Tathgur, Shreyas Movva, Dilon Heyliger, Dilpreet Bajwa, Harsh Thaker, Jeremy Gordon, Saad bin Zafar (captain), Junaid Siddiqui, Kaleem Sana, Nicholas Kirton, Pargat Singh, Rayyan Khan Pathan.
